question.title: Will Mexico eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican government officially announces the complete elimination of export taxes on all agricultural products. The announcement must be confirmed by official government statements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or Bloomberg). Partial reductions or eliminations for specific agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such comprehensive announcement is made by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are implemented, the question will resolve as NO.

Any partial reductions or eliminations for specific agricultural products will be sufficient for a NO resolution. Verification must come from authoritative U.S. government entities (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two prominent national news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). These funds must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects within California. If the cumulative grants awarded to California do not surpass $300 million by the given date, or if there is a lack of adequate evidence to verify such an award, the answer will be NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

4. The confirmation must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- Such a mission occurs by the specified date.

- The Orion capsule is used for crewed missions or launches to the ISS with a return flight.

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

1. No official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. No press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. 4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:

3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially announced by the Texas Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of abortion rights protection. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Texas not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Texas Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of abortion rights protection. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state constitution or legislation. question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Larry Page on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Larry Page on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Larry Page must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Imelda Marcos remain in prison for her corruption sentence in July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, for the entire month of July 2024, Imelda Marcos is serving her corruption sentence in prison and has not been granted house arrest or any other form of release. The resolution will be based on official announcements from Philippine authorities or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, The Straits Times) confirming her continued imprisonment throughout July 2024. If she is released, allowed to serve her sentence under house arrest, or granted any form of temporary release during July 2024, even if it's just for a portion of the month, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'prison' refers to a standard correctional facility, not including house arrest or any form of modified confinement outside a traditional prison setting.

question.title: Will Xiaomi distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi officially distributes its smartphones to North Korean athletes participating in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. For a YES resolution, all of the following conditions must be met:

1. Xiaomi must proceed with the distribution despite any potential concerns about U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The distribution must be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.
3. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

The question resolves as NO if any of the following occur:
1. Xiaomi officially announces that it will not distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The distribution is officially halted or canceled before completion.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is no clear confirmation that the distribution to North Korean athletes has taken place.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it occurs.

2. The distribution must not be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Joe Biden for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses Joe Biden for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) does not officially endorse Joe Biden for the presidential election. The endorsement must not be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If an endorsement is made by the resolution date for a different candidate, or if no endorsement is made, the question resolves as NO.
